title: Adaptive Damage Broken On Corki
body:
I build AD so it does physical damage. Corki deals 90% magic damage. Adaptive damage runes should match that. 

EDIT: I'm not talking about Corki's concept. I love that he's a magic damage ADC and it makes room for stuff like Talon/Zed mid if Corki goes bot. It's fantastic. My problem is that all the adaptive damage runes STILL do physical damage on Corki.

replies.body:
Most of the adaptive sources off the top of my head are giving adaptive AD/AP, rather than doing adaptive magic/physical damage directly. Some scale with either AD or AP depending on what results in the most damage (not necessarily the one that is numerically greater) output, although you'd want that, since if doing mixed damage results in more damage than all magic, than surely thats a good thing? 

Also, why do you want to do majority magic damage, particularly as corki? Corki usually doesn't get to build void staff until quite late, so you generally want opponents to resist the urge to build MR, rather than giving them even more reason to.

To be fair, it might be an intended anti-synergy since magic damage tends to be stronger early game anyway because people have less MR than they do Armor. It's still awkward though and dissuades some champions from those choices. It would be better if it just calculated your highest damage type on the fly but that might be too resource intensive. If it could just be like you say Electrocute is and just give you the one that does more damage, that wouldn't be bad either.

It *is* giving the one that does more damage, at least according to wikis and tooltips. 

(Calculating a champs highest damage type done in a given game is something the game already does for camille.)

Theres basically 3 ways the game could handle it:

1. If AD is highest, always do physical damage. If AP is highest, always do magic damage.

2. Regardless of if AD/AP is higher, deal the damage type that results in most damage to the target.

3. Regardless of if AD/AP is higher, deal the damage type that the user has primarily dealt during the game.

The first one is simplest, and is good for resulting in correct itemization choices from players who don't realise that "AD damage" doesn't necessarily mean physical damage, and "AP damage" doesn't necessarily mean magic damage. Potentially results in non-optimal damage, and could lead to weird optimisations on hybrid champs and weird champs like corki.

The second one is what the game currently does, and favours the user since they don't have to think and can just build normally and get the optimal damage type. Potentially frustrating to opponents who want to counter build them.

The third one is best for players looking to reactively counter build, since if someone is a major magic damage threat, they can build MR and don't need to worry about the damage type from the rune adapting.

It sounds like the OP feels it works the first way, the intended reality is the second way, and the requested change is for it to work the third way (despite that being a nerf).

Curious what your other items were where you'd be expecting WW to do more magic damage in the first place.

edit: Ah, press the attack itself does a chunk of damage. In any case, I've been pretty careful to specify "according to wikis/tooltips", so if those are wrong, then naturally much of what I said isn't reflective of reality. 

That said, corki being able to do both burst magic damage and burst physical damage simultaneously is a good thing for corki, so I'm still not convinced that changing things based on primary damage type is necessarily an advantage for corki.

It absolutely is not under any somewhat realistic circumstances. It's always preferable for those to be magic damage because 1. it's harder to stack MR and base MR is lower 2. Corki gets 18 Mpen from Sorcs amplifying magic damage 3. If they were to massively MR stack such as Visage + Adaptive Helm + Mercs, Corki would either buy Void or, more likely, he'd try to attack the targets not stacking full MR (vs squishies, magic damage will always be more useful to you as Corki). Even if they had 3 MR stacking mega tanks, I'd STILL want it to be magic damage on Corki because I'd be doign my best to kill their ADC and Mid first while then trying to just sustain through the tanks. The whole "HYBRID SO OP CAN'T ITEMIZE!!!!" idea is virtually never correct. All the champions who have that damage profile fall off past mid game because penetration items suck on them (there is no dual penetration item). It's only useful mid game or vs squishies who can't afford 2 defensive items. Furthermore, Electrocute and others like it are not procced enough to actually alter your damage profile. It's not like because Electrocude does physical damage, my mid laner is going to need to build Zhonya's. It's maybe a 2-3% tilt in your overall damage to physical. I'm not trying to be rude, there are just some big misconceptions.

Well actually in the comps where corki fits in it's a bit more complicated than that. But first here's some inherent stuff on damage types:

The damage reduction from each point of resistance decreases the higher you get, so it's better to buy 30 armour and 30 magic resist if they deal 50-50 mixed damage, than to buy 60 magic resist against full magic damage. (pretending that you can somehow choose the enemy's damage composition.)

next up, comps:

majority AD with corki to balance out - easy. Magic damage heavily preferred
Average random solo queue team - it's really random but there tends to be a mage mid and physical damage top and jungle, but it tends to be half AD half tanky, so I'd say not including ADC, teams are balanced in damage. Considering Corki, he deals mostly magical so maybe physical would be preferred if the mage is DPS and not burst (so tanks focus MR vs that target), otherwise burst mages don't really get through tank's hp bar too quickly. 
Can't think of much else...

Yeah, but consider why you want a mix of physical and magic damage on a team.

Being all physical or magical isn't inherently an issue on its own, the problem becomes it allows the enemy to stack MR or armour, meaning all of the team damage is getting reduced, and in the majority of cases that reduced damage is going to be less than a champ dealing the opposite damage type is likely to be doing. In other words, the reason you want mixed damage in a comp is so you can maximise your teams total damage output.

Currently, the adaptive damage does whatever damage type results in maximum damage output. If in a given circumstance that means it's doing say, 250 physical damage, it seems strange to want it to do the opposite kind if it means it'll do only 200 magic damage instead, since you'd just lose out on 50 damage, and since damage is ultimately what matters changing how it works for corki would be a nerf.

(I suppose it's possible that the point of the thread actually is "Nerf Corki! He shouldn't be able to do a big chunk of magic damage with his abilities/AA's *and* do a big chunk of physical damage via electrocute so people can't itemize against him!", and it may well shake out that that is a problem, but the impression I've largely gotten is they think it'd actually be better for corki if it did magic, which strikes me as a misunderstanding.)

I agree for some parts of early game, but in teamfights definitely not

actually it *is* better for corki to have full magic damage, while you are right in that balancing out damage *over a comp* is good, in general if you deal both on the same abilities and attacks it's much more reduced if the tank is well aware of what corki does and builds both resists. 

The point of spreading out damage over multiple champions is that if you have full magic damage the enemy's armour will be useless, and if you have full physical the enemy's magic resist will be useless, so it can be that the cassiopeia shreds the tank better because if that tank doesn't build armour, the full lethality kha'zix will actually plow through him like a squishy (if he does have armour, kha'zix just treats the tank like a tank... and doesn't try to combo him.). At best, it's like their resistance is reduced, at worst, they're the same - if both the kha'zix and the cassiopeia are 2v1-ing the tank, or if it's an ashe + cassiopeia and there's only one tank on the enemy team they can aim right now safely.

If Corki had it so that his abilities all did magic damage scaling on AD while his auto attacks all did physical damage, and he could cast without interrupting autos (so his typical teamfight would look something like attack moving vs the galio while quickly moving your cursor to aim R at the rammus, DPSing both simultaneously), then you'd definitely be right. Instead, all his abilities deal both types of damage, and he can only really DPS one target at a time.

My understanding of adaptive being "deals whatever would do more damage" is that if corki was DPSing a full armour rammus, electrocute would proc and do magic damage, and if that same corki switched targets and started DPSing a full MR galio, electrocute would proc and do physical damage. Another posts testing seems to indicate it doesn't work that way (which might be a bug, or it might bbe wiki being wrong, or maybe theres other factors), so it might be dumber about things, but it doing things the dumb way still might be to corkis advantage.

Consider that theres more sources of anti-magic burst than anti physical burst (nullfiying orb exists as a rune, but I don't think theres a physical counterpart, hexdrinker exists, etc.), so forcing it to be always magic for corki seems not ideal.

If it was 'whatever deals more damage', yeah for sure I agree. But I assumed it meant 'AP = magic, AD = physical', in which case I disagree with Corki being the same because his damage is set up like 'AP = magic, AD = mostly magic'.

There are more sources of anti-magic burst, yes, but not everyone will be taking these, and they're temporary. More importantly, Corki is a DPS champion first and foremost. The small shields are meant to give an extra ability cast in burst vs burst where one ability can decide who dies.

It would be great if it had on the fly calculations always picking the highest damage option vs any opponent you face. That would have perfect synergy with any build and kit (as would true damage) but it's not what happens.

I asked Riot about this and they said it works fine because Corki's a hybrid champion. This isn't really true anymore. He's a magic damage ADC opening up new comps. He's hybrid in the same way that TF is hybrid while building full AP. Corki does 87% magic damage and so does TF. 

Whether or not they intend to do something about this so he can have the same array of choices is a separate question but there's no doubt it currently gimps all the choices dealing "adaptive damage" (even if perhaps they are still the best options for him). In fact, it would be great if they were manual damage so I can put it to magic myself if the game doesn't understand my intentions or the champion's kit. This could be a little knob in the rune pages at champ select.

In WW's case, it's more valid since he is a true hybrid champion and you don't itemize magic penetration anyway. However, it would still be great if the player could have a choice whenever this "adaptive damage" malfunctions or just doesn't work as desired. Ideally, the game would just look at your build/abilities and give you the highest damage option vs a generic target with let's say 100 MR and 100 armor.
It should be put in corki's passive, 'adaptive magic/physical damage will always take magic damage, adaptive ap/ad is unaffected'
